medical_history.chief_complaint: Delayed puberty and poor growth at age 15.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The proband presented at 15.9 years of age with delayed puberty. After a course of testosterone treatment, puberty progressed normally, culminating in discharge from follow-up by age 17.9. The younger brother was referred at 11.7 years with concerns about short stature and delayed puberty. Despite treatment, he showed no spontaneous development by 15.5 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The younger brother had mild asthma; otherwise, past medical history was unremarkable for both individuals.
medical_history.family_history: Both brothers had significant family history of delayed puberty and isolated hypogonadotropic hypogonadism (IHH).
